xxl.core.pipes.processors
Class CircularProcessorList

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.pipes.processors.CircularProcessorList

public class CircularProcessorList
extends Object

This class implements a circular list that can store processors.

Since:
1.1
See Also:
Processor

Constructor Summary
CircularProcessorList()
           
 
Method Summary
 void add(Processor proc)
          Adds a Processor to this list.
 void addAfter(Processor proc, Processor predecessor)
          Inserts a Processor right after another one.

          Tests whether this list contains a certain Processor or not.
 Processor getNext()
          Shifts the head of this list to the second element and returns it.
 Processor getNextUnblocked()
          Shifts the head of this list to the first element after the head element that is not blocked and returns it.

          Tests whether this list is empty or not.

          Removes a Processor from this list.
 void setBlocked(Processor proc)
          Informs this list that a processor is blocked.
 void setBlockedUntil(Processor proc, long timestamp)
          Informs this list that a processor is blocked and will stay blocked until a certain point in time is reached.

Constructor Detail

CircularProcessorList

public CircularProcessorList()
Method Detail

add

public void add(Processor proc)
Adds a Processor to this list.
It is inserted at the (current) end of the list.

Parameters:
proc - the Processor to be inserted

addAfter

public void addAfter(Processor proc,
                     Processor predecessor)
Inserts a Processor right after another one.

Parameters:
proc - the Processor to be inserted
predecessor - the Processor after which the Processor should be inserted
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if this list does not contain predecessor

contains

public boolean contains(Processor proc)
Tests whether this list contains a certain Processor or not.

Parameters:
proc - the Processor
Returns:
true if this list contains the Processor, false otherwise

getNext

public Processor getNext()
Shifts the head of this list to the second element and returns it. The former head element is thereby transfered to the end of the list.

Returns:
the new head element

getNextUnblocked

public Processor getNextUnblocked()
Shifts the head of this list to the first element after the head element that is not blocked and returns it.

Returns:
the new head element or null if all Processors are blocked

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Tests whether this list is empty or not.

Returns:
true if and only if this list is empty.

remove

public void remove(Processor proc)
Removes a Processor from this list.

Parameters:
proc - the Processor to be removed
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if this list does not contain the Processor

setBlocked

public void setBlocked(Processor proc)
Informs this list that a processor is blocked.

Parameters:
proc - the blocked Processor
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if this list does not contain the Processor

setBlockedUntil

public void setBlockedUntil(Processor proc,
                            long timestamp)
Informs this list that a processor is blocked and will stay blocked until a certain point in time is reached.

Parameters:
proc - the blocked Processor
timestamp - the time when the Processor will be unblocked again.
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if this list does not contain the Processor

setUnblocked

public void setUnblocked(Processor proc)
Informs this list that a processor is not blocked anymore.

Parameters:
proc - the unblocked Processor
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if this list does not contain the Processor

size

public int size()
Returns:
the current number of processors
